page.title: 01Cropredy Area
page.content: It is a rural area with Cropredy village at the centre. It is situated in the Cherwell Valley. The River Cherwell runs through the village. There is a large farming community which is long established.Cropredy is written in the original Doomsday book as Cropelie belonging to the Bishop of Lincoln, as was much of the surrounding area. When the canal came through in the 1790's the area around the canal grew. The railway runs through the village but no longer stops as there is no longer any station. Station Road is all that survives. Cropredy's main claim to fame in history is that it is the site of a major battle in the Civil War, the Battle of Cropredy Bridge, in 1645.
